trans-unit.source: On-Premises File Server Linked Service
trans-unit.target: On-Premises File Server Linked Service

trans-unit.source: On-Premises File Server Linked Service
trans-unit.target: On-Premises File Server Linked Service

trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="28d6c506-71a9-4c74-b1d8-be3688b1aa4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises File System Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="28d6c506-71a9-4c74-b1d8-be3688b1aa4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises File System Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the JSON properties for a linked service of type: <embeddedLabel>File System (Windows/Linux network share or local disk)</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the JSON properties for a linked service of type: <embeddedLabel>File System (Windows/Linux network share or local disk)</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Supported file formats
trans-unit.target: Supported file formats

trans-unit.source: When you use a linked service of type <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesFileSystemLinkedService</embeddedLabel> with the Copy Activity, the activity can copy a file of any format (CSV/TSV/AVRO/JSON/XML, etc…)
trans-unit.target: When you use a linked service of type <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesFileSystemLinkedService</embeddedLabel> with the Copy Activity, the activity can copy a file of any format (CSV/TSV/AVRO/JSON/XML, etc…)

trans-unit.source: as it-is from the source to the destination.
trans-unit.target: as it-is from the source to the destination.

trans-unit.source: Supported Gateway and PowerShell version
trans-unit.target: Supported Gateway and PowerShell version

trans-unit.source: The File Server linked service requires you to install and configure Data Management Gateway on an on-premises Windows server.
trans-unit.target: The File Server linked service requires you to install and configure Data Management Gateway on an on-premises Windows server.

trans-unit.source: For details about the Data Management Gateway, see <externalLink><linkText>Enable your pipelines to access on-premises data</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-onpremises-datasources</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For details about the Data Management Gateway, see <externalLink><linkText>Enable your pipelines to access on-premises data</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-onpremises-datasources</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The supported gateway version is: <externalLink><linkText>1.4.5492.1</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39717</linkUri></externalLink> or higher.
trans-unit.target: The supported gateway version is: <externalLink><linkText>1.4.5492.1</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39717</linkUri></externalLink> or higher.

trans-unit.source: You must use the Azure PowerShell of version <externalLink><linkText>0.8.14</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=320376%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink> or higher to use cmdlets such as New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue with type parameter set to OnPremisesFileSystemLinkedService..
trans-unit.target: You must use the Azure PowerShell of version <externalLink><linkText>0.8.14</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=320376%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink> or higher to use cmdlets such as New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue with type parameter set to OnPremisesFileSystemLinkedService..

trans-unit.source: Linux file share configuration
trans-unit.target: Linux file share configuration

trans-unit.source: Perform the following two steps to use a Linux file share with the File Server Linked Service:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following two steps to use a Linux file share with the File Server Linked Service:

trans-unit.source: Install <externalLink><linkText>Samba</linkText><linkUri>https://www.samba.org/</linkUri></externalLink> on your Linux Server.
trans-unit.target: Install <externalLink><linkText>Samba</linkText><linkUri>https://www.samba.org/</linkUri></externalLink> on your Linux Server.

trans-unit.source: Install and configure Data Management Gateway on a Windows server.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure Data Management Gateway on a Windows server.

trans-unit.source: Installing gateway on a Linux server is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Installing gateway on a Linux server is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> property should be set to <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesFileServer</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>type</embeddedLabel> property should be set to <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesFileServer</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: host
trans-unit.target: host

trans-unit.source: Host name of the server.
trans-unit.target: Host name of the server.

trans-unit.source: Use ‘ \ ’ as the escape character as in the following example: if your share is: \\servername, specify \\\\servername.
trans-unit.target: Use ‘ \ ’ as the escape character as in the following example: if your share is: \\servername, specify \\\\servername.

trans-unit.source: If the file system is local to the gateway machine, use <embeddedLabel>Local</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>localhost</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: If the file system is local to the gateway machine, use <embeddedLabel>Local</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>localhost</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If the file system is on a server different from the gateway machine, use <embeddedLabel>\\\\servername</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: If the file system is on a server different from the gateway machine, use <embeddedLabel>\\\\servername</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: userid
trans-unit.target: userid

trans-unit.source: Specify the ID of the user who has access to the server.
trans-unit.target: Specify the ID of the user who has access to the server.

trans-unit.source: No (if you choose <embeddedLabel>encryptedcredential</embeddedLabel>).
trans-unit.target: No (if you choose <embeddedLabel>encryptedcredential</embeddedLabel>).

trans-unit.source: password
trans-unit.target: password

trans-unit.source: Specify the password for the user (userid).
trans-unit.target: Specify the password for the user (userid).

trans-unit.source: No (if you choose <embeddedLabel>encryptedcredential</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: No (if you choose <embeddedLabel>encryptedcredential</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: encryptedcredential
trans-unit.target: encryptedcredential

trans-unit.source: Specify the encrypted credentials that you can get by running the <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn834940.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Specify the encrypted credentials that you can get by running the <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn834940.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: No (if you choose to specify <embeddedLabel>userid</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>password</embeddedLabel> in plain text)
trans-unit.target: No (if you choose to specify <embeddedLabel>userid</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>password</embeddedLabel> in plain text)

trans-unit.source: gatewayname
trans-unit.target: gatewayname

trans-unit.source: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises file server.
trans-unit.target: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises file server.

trans-unit.source: You must use the gateway of version <externalLink><linkText>1.4.5492.1</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39717</linkUri></externalLink> or higher.
trans-unit.target: You must use the gateway of version <externalLink><linkText>1.4.5492.1</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=39717</linkUri></externalLink> or higher.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Example 1 (using username and password in plain text)
trans-unit.target: Example 1 (using username and password in plain text)

trans-unit.source: Example 2 (using encryptedcredential)
trans-unit.target: Example 2 (using encryptedcredential)
